meanings.definition: To distort or twist out of shape
meanings.sent1: The funhouse mirror skewed my reflection.
meanings.sent2: The artist skewed the perspective in their painting for a unique effect.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat skewed the truth about who knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: Her memories of the event were skewed by her strong emotions.
meanings.sent5: The storm's strong winds skewed the tree branches in all directions.

meanings.definition: To cause to be biased or distorted
meanings.sent1: The misleading advertisement skewed the customers' opinions.
meanings.sent2: The news report was skewed to favor one political party over the other.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to skew the results of the experiment backfired.
meanings.sent4: The magician's illusion skewed the audience's perception of reality.
meanings.sent5: The gossip spread quickly and skewed the truth beyond recognition.

meanings.sent1: The skewed picture frame hung crookedly on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The old wooden floorboards were warped and skewed from years of use.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's skewed sense of humor always made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The detective followed the skewed footprints to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The skewed horizon made the landscape look surreal in the painting.
